Helping people with Parkinson's reclaim independence

The Eye Guide MC is a new device invented by a person with Parkinson's, for people with Parkinson's

Contact us today

Introducing the Eye Guide MC

The Eye Guide MC is a new device invented by a person with Parkinson’s, for people with Parkinson’s. It is a simple, wearable aid that can drastically improve the quality of life of a person with Parkinson’s Disease.

The device sits discreetly over the wearer’s ear, lining up to their visual field. It provides a visual sensory stimulus which can help to improve a person with Parkinson’s balance, walking and tremor.

About The Eye Guide MC

No surgery

No surgery required - just a simple fitting by our experts

No wires

The device is wireless and discreet

No batteries

The device doesn’t require charging or batteries

Just simple...

The design is simple, effective, unobtrusive and subtle

How it works

  • The Eye Guide MC is a simple device that can instantly improve the debilitating symptoms of Parkinson’s Disease (speech, tremor, movement, coordination).
  • The Eye Guide MC is worn over the ear, pointing out along the eye line and sites along the meridian line.
  • The Guide sits in the peripheral vision, so that the eye only sees the very tip of it.
  • This enables the brain to work with the eye, giving new signals to the Basal Ganglia, the part of the brain that controls movement.
Call us on 01406 362 028 or Book a free consultation

Driven to help people with Parkinson’s

Eye Guide MC was created by a person with Parkinson’s, for people with Parkinson’s. Every Parkinson’s person is welcome to talk to us about a fitting.

The device was born out of a very personal Parkinson’s journey. Sandra, the inventor of Eye Guide MC, is in a unique position to understand the needs of people with Parkinson’s and her mission is to improve the lives of those with the condition. She persevered to create a device that will change lives for the better.

Patients first

Here at Eye Guide MC, patient care is our top priority. We’re here to guide you through the full process of living with your new Eye Guide MC, from an initial consultation, to the fitting, to follow up advice. All of our highly trained team of technicians come from caring backgrounds and are trained by a Parkinson’s Nurse Specialist.

Our friendly staff will greet you at the door of our clinic and will be with you all the way to reclaiming your independence.

Watch now

About me

Hello! I’m Sandra McDonough, the inventor, founder and Director of the Eye Guide MC. I was diagnosed with Parkinson’s on the eve of my 40th birthday and my symptoms rapidly worsened.

News

What is Parkinson’s Disease?

Dopamine acts as a neurotransmitter passing signal to the neurons, once these cell die, the brain cannot produce the dopamine to keep the patient's movements controlled...
